reviewText: Nice look at Golub making a painting for a show in Derry. Good behind the scenes and interviews. Great for Art appreciation classes.
Exquisite look at the artist's process.

One of the best videos of an artist working, considering and talking about his work. Spero and Golub's  mutually supportive relationship is wonderful to observe, and the growing old in the art life is a central theme. Golub's committed social and political work is important, and this film explores it in depth. Highly recommended!
This is a great documentary that draws you into the art and mind of Leon Golub.  One of the best "artist at work" profiles I've seen.
This has always been one of my favorite Kartemquin films and with the other films about Nancy Spero on the same DVD I like it even better.
